title: Testing Typography On The Web
content:
what tools do you use to test typefaces, combinations, and colours on the web.

for example, there's the typecast tool [http://typecast.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070203/http:/typecast.com/ "http://typecast.com/"). which i don't like because it only shows the name of the typeface when doing selections. i find it hard to make judgements with only small samples.

so what i currently use is Adobe Edge Animate [http://html.adobe.com/edge/animate/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070203/http:/html.adobe.com/edge/animate/ "http://html.adobe.com/edge/animate/"). it's meant for html/css animation, but it allows for the quick use of web fonts and their preview.
author: Chris Hunt
